intro: Hieracium aidnocephalum, commonly known as the dark-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically has basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy, while the upper leaves are smaller and more elongated. It is native to regions of Europe and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Hieracium aidnocephalum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinator populations.
